intro: Hieracium clonodes, commonly known as the clustered hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with basal leaves that are broadly lanceolate and hairy. Its flowering period occurs from late spring to early autumn, producing yellow flowers that attract pollinators. Hieracium clonodes spreads through vegetative reproduction, forming dense colonies that can dominate grassland habitats.
